vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἐξᾰγορ-άξω,
buy from, τι παρά τινος [Refs 2nd c.BC+]; buy up, [Refs 1st c.AD+]; buy off, μικροῦ διαφόρου τὸν ἀδικηθέντα [Refs 4th c.BC+]; redeem, [NT+1st c.BC+]:—middle, ἐξαγοράξεσθαι τὸν καιρόν [LXX+NT]
vocabInfos.shortDef: (act.) to redeem, as a figurative extension of the act of purchasing something in the marketplace; (middle) to make the most (of the time)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
(act.) to redeem, as a figurative extension of the act of purchasing something in the marketplace; (middle) to make the most (of the time)
to buy out, of the hands of a person; to redeem, set free, Gal. 3:13; 4:5; middle to redeem, buy off, to secure for one's self or one's own use; to rescue from loss or misapplication, Eph. 5:16; Col. 4:5*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: redimir, liberar ; (voz media) aprovechar al máximo, aprovechar bien
